If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.29-5 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @joekaufmanexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1760364104660629) ## Action Performed: 1. Create a workspace 2. Follow the test bank account steps to setup a PENDING bank account on the workflows page 3. Delete the workspace 4. Create a second workspace 5. Begin adding the same manual account/routing as step 2 6. Notice you see the PENDING bank account test transactions step right after entering account/routing 7. Close the RHP 8. Go offline 9. Go Online 10. Tap the bank account row. ## Expected Result: You see the test transactions step when tapping the bank account row. ## Actual Result: You are asked to add a new bank account, even though there should be a pending bank account linked to this workspace. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] Reduce log requests

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from slack [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C08CZDJFJ77/p1760108451520379) **Problem:** When every log entry is sent immediately after it’s created, it causes excessive network traffic and server load, which prevents the app from maintaining efficient performance and low resource usage. **Solution:** Batch log entries together and send them periodically or when thresholds are reached, reducing redundant network operations while preserving logging accuracy and reliability. **Batched logs (1st screenshot) Total time - 513ms** ``` Log Types: Info: 1,208 (100%) Warnings: 0 Errors: 0 Top Commands (API calls): OpenReport - 193 (15.98%) AuthenticatePusher - 55 (4.55%) PusherPing - 25 (2.07%) ReadNewestAction - 6 (0.50%) Log - 1 (0.08%) Top Components: Onyx - 309 (25.58%) - State management API - 152 (12.58%) - API calls SequentialQueue - 149 (12.33%) - Request queue OnyxUpdateManager - 129 (10.68%) - State updates OnyxDerived - 106 (8.77%) - Derived state PersistedRequests - 87 (7.20%) - Request persistence Network - 85 (7.04%) - Network operations Pusher - 54 (4.47%) - Real-time updates ``` **Non Batched logs (2nd screenshot): Total time for the chosen log - 433ms** ``` Log Types: Info: 40 (97.56%) Alert: 1 (2.44%) Top Commands (API calls): OpenReport - 6 (14.63%) AuthenticatePusher - 5 (12.20%) Log - 1 (2.44%) Top Components: OnyxUpdateManager - 12 (29.27%) - State updates Network - 6 (14.63%) - Network operations Onyx - 5 (12.20%) - State management Pusher - 3 (7.32%) - Real-time updates SequentialQueue - 3 (7.32%) - Request queue PusherAuthorizer - 2 (4.88%) - Auth API - 2 (4.88%) - API calls RequestThrottle - SequentialQueue - 2 (4.88%) - Throttling PersistedRequests - 2 (4.88%) - Request persistence BootSplash - 2 (4.88%) - Splash screen ``` Draft PR: [Expensify/App#71680](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71680)
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~021977711077939584512
  • Upwork Job ID: 1977711077939584512
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-10-13
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @hoangzinh

Close the RHP 6. Drag and drop a video to Scan zone 7. Click Create expense 8. Open the expense thread ## Expected Result: "Invalid file type" error will show up when dropping a video to Scan zone in workspace chat ## Actual Result: User can create a scan expense with video as receipt by dropping a video to Scan zone in workspace chat There is no "Invalid file type" error After creating the expense, error shows up in transaction thread ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.29-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1235/41237176/945414899?q=split&issue_type=jira **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+101001kh@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Workspace has card transactions. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Open the card transaction. 4. Go offline. 5. Click More > Split. 6. Click Save. 7. Open the split. → The split appears as cash instead of card expense when card transaction is split offline. Amount field shows Cash. Card field is missing. 8. Go online. → The split becomes card transaction after returning online. ## Expected Result: In Step 7, when card expense is split offline, the transaction thread of the split will show the same card details as the original card expense. ## Actual Result: In Step 7, when card expense is split offline, the transaction thread of the split does not show the same card details as the original card expense. Amount field shows Cash. Card field is missing. It shows Reimbursable toggle instead of Card field. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0278ac2f-5ad6-4171-85e0-5ffc624cb1d0 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.29-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1235/41236875/945414720?q=report+field&issue_type=jira **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** djjddkkdkddkldld@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Launch Expensify app. 2. Go to workspace settings > Reports. 3. Enable Report fields. 4. Upgrade workspace if prompted. 5. Tap Add field. 6. Enter B as name and select any type. 7. Tap Save. 8. Tap Add field. 9. Enter A as name (IMPORTANT) and select any type. 10. Tap Save. ## Expected Result: The new report field will be created on top of the first report field as it is arranged alphabetically. ## Actual Result: The new report field is blank and it is created below the first report field. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dbf72293-c419-457f-b1d5-3eb33892e500 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
